name: Barnsdale Lodge Hotel and Restaurant

reviews.title: A great hotel...but don't pay their "rack rate"
reviews.text: This is a cracking hotel....but just make sure you don't pay the excessively high hotel "rack rates" advertised on the hotel website. (If we'd been paying the rack rates, the rating score on this review would have been lower)

The hotel is based around a courtyard, with rooms in small stone buildings overlooking the garden areas of the courtyard. It's very peaceful with only the audible sound being wildlife and other guests chatting in the garden. The rooms are nicely decorated and set out - we didn't spot anything that was obviously missing. They certainly warrant the 3 or 4* rating the hotel has got.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, nothing was too much trouble

reviews.text: Part of the restaurant is based in a conservatory overlooking the courtyard. There's a great menu, which showcases locally produced food. The night we were there, the food was simply brilliant. The food at breakfast was equally as good, although the waitress service in the morning let the hotel down a little. (An additional waiter/waitress would probably have sorted things out.)
reviews.title: Great food and service

reviews.text: Finally, the hotel is close to some great market towns such as Oakham. Combine this with the close proximity to Barnsdale Gardens (approx. 1 mile), which were designed and "built" by Geoff Hamilton while he was presenting on BBC2. Additionally, the hotel is very close to Rutland Water, which has a cyclepath around it. If you want to bike around, there are a couple of locations where you can hire bikes, or alternatively you can walk the 17.5mile route (it took us 5 hours including lunch stop).
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a great place to stay and eat at.
reviews.title: Worth every penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, clean rooms, huge comfy bed, nice toiletries, fab fresh coffee and cafetiere in the room. helpful and cheery staff.gorgeous breakfast. beautiful location.
reviews.title: quaint, quiet & lovely country hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel as a party of 8 over a long weekend at the start of the winter half term. It was great to leave home (in Derbyshire) mid morning and be at the hotel before lunch, with no airport hassle etc.
reviews.title: Relaxed and Refreshed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in a quiet location close to the lake and near to Oakham and Stamford. Our experience matched many other reviewers in that the staff were very helpful and looked after us very well over the weekend. Our special thanks go to Paul, General Manager, who resolved two minor issues to our complete satisfaction. He also drew our attention to the "2 for 1" offers book, and stamped them up at the hotel. This saved us jointly, about £60, in our visits to Burghley House and Barnsdale Gardens.
reviews.title: perfect great for a relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a half board package which meant we could choose anything from the evening menu, and were pleased to discover this included side orders at no extra cost and tea/coffee. All food was prepared to a high standard and the steak and halibut options were great.
reviews.title: Good rooms, very clean and friendly hotel but 10% Service charge on meal we didn't like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathrooms have been refurbished and the showers, with remote control, were first class.
reviews.title: One of the friendliest hotels we have stayed in

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as part of a family reunion. The staff were slow and inefficient. The rooms were dull and very basic.
reviews.title: Not a great experience!!

reviews.text: Very disappointed. The food was 'OK' although a little bland; Not in the league of a good hotel or restaurant.
reviews.title: doggie heaven

reviews.text: Wished I had tried one of the other hotels on the water. Will not stay again.
reviews.title: A great hotel, in a beautiful part of the country – I will definitely be returning!

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the hotel with my owner and my size did not put anyone off at all, I was treated fantastic by the stafff. Never been to such a doggie friendly hotel. Lots of lovely walks for me to go on. The food smelt fantastic. I travelled there and back to the train station by taxi and my owner was not charged extra for me so think the lady who was over charged for taxi was just picked up by a rouge taxi driver, this is the responsibility of taxi licensing as I believe that the hotel can only recommend a taxi and are not linked to or own any taxi firm. If like my owner you like to pamper your best friend this is the place for you xxx Also on watching the real hustler one night with my owner it was mentioned that these hustlers do travel to hotels and scam people in the most uncanny way. However a friend of my owner had the same done to her but while travelling on the train but the thief was caught when the cashpoint camera was checked they all have CTV.
reviews.title: Brilliant Barnsdale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed in this lovely country house hotel with a friend for a short break. Many friends have told me how nice Barnsdale Lodge is and our stay really didn’t disappoint. My lasting memories of Barnsdale are the relaxed informal atmosphere, outstanding food and above all the friendly, helpful staff (nothing seemed too much trouble). We were fortunate enough to have excellent weather, as a result we were able to eat our evening meal in the delightful courtyard. We enjoyed a superb meal and we were recommended excellent wine by the Hotel’s general manager. I recommend the steak, locally reared on a farm down the road from the hotel. It is evident that they place an emphasis on sourcing produce from local producers (the hotel even has its own hens!).
reviews.title: The ultimate expression of personalized service and intimate elegance!

reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms, a double for myself and my husband and the twin room next door for 2 of our teenage children, mainly on the strength of the earlier reviews but also because it was in the brides list of suggested accommodation.
reviews.title: Disappointing.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived bang on earliest check in time as we were attending a wedding at 4pm, 3.5 miles down the road, and wanted to change and freshen up, the rooms weren't ready despite me ringing ahead but staff did their best and we only had to wait 20 minutes. Unfortunately the rooms themselves were a little dingy and perhaps need a lick of paint. Magnolia walls and well used green carpet don't really do it for me anyway. The photos on the website show modern, well dressed rooms - not the ones we had!
reviews.title: Highly recommended.... friendly staff, great location and amazing food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The towel rail in our bathroom had been replaced and where it used to be was clearly visible, having been filled but not painted. Our shower was not adjustable, whichever way it was turned the temperature of the water was "fresh" to say the least.
reviews.title: Avoid....

reviews.text: We had booked a taxi, through reception, to take us to and from the wedding venue, a lovely day was spoiled by the taxi driver charging £20 on the way back having charged £6 on the way there, when asked why he said it was because he would have to return empty and it had gone midnight which he stated the hotel should have informed us - a total rip off.
reviews.title: Great venue for family celebration

reviews.text: In fairness though the staff were very pleasant and breakfast the following day was good.
reviews.title: don't leave any valuables in your room, carry everything with you as they have a major theft/fraud problem

description: This converted farmhouse is in beautiful countryside, 900 metres from the north shore of Rutland Water. It has free Wi-Fi, free parking, a restaurant and a spa offering beauty treatments.Barnsdale Lodge is a privately owned hotel in Rutland, the smallest county in England. It is 3.5 miles (5.6 km) from the historic town of Oakham and 22 miles (35 km) from Leicester.The en suite rooms are individually furnished and have views of the surrounding countryside or the courtyard.The rooms have Freeview digital TVs, tea/coffee with biscuits and luxury toiletries from the White Company.Barnsdale Lodge offers a full cooked English breakfast each morning. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are made using local, seasonal food.The Viciente spa offers relaxing and therapeutic spa and beauty treatments.Hotel Rooms: 44.
